Sequence Information.Peptide Name: sfTSLP (short form Thymic stromal lymphopoietin, isoform 2, cytokine, natural AMPs; human,  primates, mammals,  animals; Other fragments: MKK34)
Sequence Information.Source: keratinocytes, oral mucosa/salivary glands, skin, gut,Homo sapiens

Literature Information.Literature: This sfTSLP is the predominant form of TSLP. The sfTSLP form showed poor similarity (30.4%) TObacterial Enterocin EJ97Activity: Compared to the long form, which was also reproted to be antimicrobial mainly against Gram- bacteria (Sonesson A et al., 2011), this short form TSLP (sfTSLP) exhibited a markedly stronger antibacterial activity against B. cereus, E. coli, E. faecalis, S. mitis, S. epidermidis, and C. albicans. (Incubate 2 h followed by plating count).SAR:  MKK34 (sequence: MKKRRKRKVTTNKCLEQVSQLQGLWRRFNRPLLK), another fragment of TSLP, is also antimicrobial in the presence of human plasma and at physiological salt conditions. Update 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Bjerkan L, Schreurs O, Engen SA, Jahnsen FL, Baekkevold ES, Blix IJ, Schenck K. 2015
Literature Information.Title: The short form of TSLP is constitutively translated in human keratinocytes and has characteristics of an antimicrobial peptide
